channel.title: Comments on: T-SQL Window Functions – Part 1: The OVER Clause
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Luis Perez Mendoza
item.dc:creator: Luis Perez Mendoza
item.description:
Excelent.
is there any way of do that in sql server 2008?
in may case i need to produce the same resulset in sql server 2008 R2. in 2012 i'm using SUM(OrderAmt) OVER (PARTITION BY CustomerName ORDER BY OrderDate, OrderID RANGE BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING and CURRENT ROW) as RangeByDate for my purpose.
Thanks!
item.content:encoded:
Excelent.

is there any way of do that in sql server 2008?

in may case i need to produce the same resulset in sql server 2008 R2.
in 2012 i’m using
SUM(OrderAmt) OVER (PARTITION BY CustomerName ORDER BY OrderDate, OrderID RANGE BETWEEN UNBOUNDED PRECEDING and CURRENT ROW) as RangeByDate
for my purpose.

Thanks!

item.title: By: Kevin Conan
item.dc:creator: Kevin Conan
item.description: Excellent article and I'm looking forward the next 3!
item.content:encoded: Excellent article and I’m looking forward the next 3!
